Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2009 11:53PM samiam40A wrote: I was also told Open MRI doesn't work for breast imaging.  Like Stavmom, I survived my last MRI by not opening my eyes once and taking Xanax.  MRI was the only thing that detected my breast cancer.  I understand the fear--I have it too--but please do it anyway.  It could save your life.
Posts.Title: Open MRI Brenda79 samiam40A

Posts.Content: samiam40A wrote: My surgeon says I will have the choice of having my bilat mx w/tissue expanders at a surgery center (which she desribed as very posh) or at a hospital.  My initial reaction is that is doesn't really matter much to me--my surgery doesn't seem that complicated and I don't have any other health problems that would put me at risk for complications.  However, my mother-in-law, who has worked most of her life in hospitals, is dead set against my going to a surgery center. What is your experience with this? IDC diagnosed 1/12/09, 1.6 cm, ER+/PR+/HER-, MIB-1 15%, bilat mx w/TEs scheduled for 2/3/09; awaiting BRCA results Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Surgery Center samiam40A MinAZ

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 08:31AM samiam40A wrote: Wonderful news Erica.  Although there is never a good time to get breast cancer, 23 is definitely too young to be dealing with this.  I am very relieved for you and wish you a long and cancer-free life! -Samiam40 (Stacy)
